Purpose Of The Job

Develop, Support, and Maintain KFC's home-grown restaurant support software, web applications, and integrate with various peripheral devices for 4000+ restaurants in the US. Tasks include software development, software integration, troubleshooting, and vendor collaboration.

Job Responsibilities
  • Assist with development to update KFC software that interfaces with restaurant and above store systems within KFC
  • Assist to help identify root cause and resolve issues occurring in the field and QA lab
  • Partner with key stakeholders to delivery on critical business initiatives including:
  • Improving restaurant software by adding new functionality
  • Security and Compliance
  • Operational improvements and enhancements
  • Execute manual test plans for software and hardware
  • Use Azure DevOps to track test script completion, code, defects, and user stories
  • Develop and maintain appropriate test environments and labs
  • Provide hardware and software support to field operations and internal IT teams as needed
  • Perform SQL data queries to define and validate test scripts
  • Perform defect management (defect logging, tracking, analysis, and validation)
  • Work with internal IT and third-party development teams to resolve hardware and software issues
  • Provide input for field training documentation and train internal support teams
  • Work on Agile project team

Knowledge + Skills Required:
  • Currently enrolled worked toward Bachelor of Science in Computer Science or equivalent education
  • Minimum 6 months of software development experience in Microsoft .Net technologies
  • Software development experience with items listed below a plus:
    • MS Visual Studio 2017/2019, C#
    • MS SQL Server 2008/2012/2016, Stored Procedures
    • ASP.Net 4.0, .Net Framework, .Net Core, HTML, CSS, JavaScript, MVC
    • PowerShell, XML
    • .Net web services development (Soap, Rest)
    • Azure cloud knowledge
    • Agile software development
  • Knowledge of the restaurant business and restaurant operations are ideal; small retail or manufacturing would be suitable as well
  • The ability to read and understand functional and technical specifications as well as other technical documents
  • Knowledge of software testing lifecycle and understanding of test design and testing methodologies is preferable
  • Proficient in development test plans and test cases from requirements, functional and technical design documentation is preferable
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Ability to learn new technologies, solve complex technical problems and multitask initiatives
  • Must be able to work independently as well as in a team environment
  • Strong problem solving and analytical capabilities
  • Demonstrate ability to work effectively in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment

Location: Malta, NY

Summary Of Role

The intern will work with our team leads on specific assignments per Manufacturing Quality functions (Material Disposition Board, 8D Problem Solving, Failure Mode Engineering Analysis) in line with GlobalFoundries Quality Management System and business processes.

In the material disposition management, function Intern will be working with the team to establish/maintain/improve KPI dashboards to help with analytics to drive improvement to the business process efficiencies. He/She would train on an updated software system and help create job aids for the fab community. He/She will also be supporting internal 8D audits together with audit team and help with analysis on results and reporting.

Essential Responsibilities
  • Perform all activities in a safe and responsible manner and support all Environmental, Health, Safety & Security requirements and programs


Required Qualifications
  • Education:

BS Student enrolled in an accredited program on Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, Quality Engineering, Computer Science, Physics, or related fields.
  • Experience: any internship experience
  • Language Fluency – English (Written & Verbal)


Preferred Qualifications
  • Manufacturing Systems knowledge/ Quality management Systems Exposure (ISO) / Semiconductor courses


If you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the employment process, please contact us by email at usaccommodations@globalfoundries.com and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information. Requests for accommodation will be considered on a case-by-case basis. Please note that only inquiries concerning a request for reasonable accommodation will be responded to from this email address.

Date: Sep 17, 2020
Location: Multiple locations across United States
As the tech firm that created the mobile world, and with more than 54,000 patents to our name, we've made it our business to make a mark. When joining our team at Ericsson you are empowered to learn, lead and perform at your best, shaping the future of technology. This is a place where you're welcomed as your own perfectly unique self, and celebrated for the skills, talent, and perspective you bring to the team. Come, and be where it begins.
In our exciting opportunities as an intern, you will enjoy:
  • 1:1 Mentorship
  • Intern Specific Events & Projects
  • Career Development
  • Peer & Senior Level Networking
  • Participation in Employee Resource Groups
In Our Internship Roles You Will Need
  • 3.0+ GPA
  • Currently pursuing an undergraduate, Master's, or PhD on a full-time basis at a 4-year college or university
  • Be available to work 40 hours per week during the summer
  • Have at least 1 semester left (post-internship)
  • Major, experience, or demonstrable interest in the position you apply for
We have several positions that fall under our Engineering Internship, we are looking for competencies that include:
  • Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Telecom Engineering, Industrial Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, or similar discipline
  • Computer Science, Technical Telecom, Electronics, or Computer Science Engineering experience
  • Technical understanding of: Cloud, Virtualization and IP
  • Exposure to Linux system
  • Coding skills (such as Python, Java, or Scala)
  • Excellent communication as well as intercultural skills
  • Open-minded and motivated to work in multicultural team
  • Strong analytical and organizational skills
  • Strong customer service orientation
The Ideal Engineering Interns Should

Be enthusiastic solution finders astute in the latest technologies, but with the non-technical savvy to be a valued and respected part of their team. We are looking for undergrad, Master's, MBA, and PhD students.
Hiring Process
Our dedicated team of University Recruiters accept applications from September through April. Most of our positions are filled during the Fall semester though, so we strongly encourage students to apply early.

Our Hiring Process Is As Follows
  • Apply online (Sept-April)
  • If selected: A recruiter contacts you via email or phone
  • If selected: Hiring manager interview
  • If selected: Offer extended
  • Start Internship (May or June)
What´s in it for you?
Here at Ericsson, our culture is built on over a century of courageous decisions. With us, you will no longer be dreaming of what the future holds - you will be redefining it. You won't develop for the status quo but will build what replaces it. Joining us is a way to move your career in any direction you want; with hundreds of career opportunities in locations all over the world, in a place where co-creation and collaboration are embedded into the walls. You will find yourself in a speak-up environment where empathy and humanness serve as cornerstones for how we work, and where work-life balance is a priority. Welcome to an inclusive, global company where your opportunity to make an impact is endless.
Are you in?
Do you believe that an organization fostering an environment of cooperation and collaboration to execute with speed creates better business value? Do you value a culture of humanness, where fact based decisions are important and our people are encouraged to speak up? Do you believe that diverse, inclusive teams drive performance and innovation? At Ericsson, we do.

position: Summer 2021 Intern Program: Business/Information Technology Opportunities: Syracuse, NY
description:
About Us

Kickstart your Career. Light your spark. Become a Gridtern.

National Grid is looking for fresh talent with innovative thinking. Sound like you? Apply now!

National Grid is transforming the energy industry and we want you to be a part of this evolution! As a Gridtern you will get on-the-job training to shape the future of energy. With this paidinternship opportunity your summer will be filled with hands on projects, countless networking opportunities, field learning experiences and professional development.

Gridterns will start on either May 24th or June 7th 2021. National Grid is aiming for an in-person intern experience for Summer 2021. However, we will continue to monitor the impacts of COVID-19 and will shift to a virtual program if necessary, in order to honor our commitment to our young talent pipeline.

For detailed information about our Gridtern program and the selection process/timeline please visit our Gridtern career website.

Job Purpose

Below Are Examples Of Majors, Different Department Summer Projects, And Past Departments

Responsibilities vary on your area of interest and department placement. We hire from a range of majors for our Gridtern program.

Supply Chain Management ▪ Business Management ▪ Project Management
  • Tackle category management, supplier relationship management and commercial negotiations
  • Work alongside program managers to research and provide information in order to forecast cost spending
2020 Gridtern Departments included: Enterprise Change Office, Corporate Affairs, Resource Planning

Marketing ▪ Graphic Design ▪ Public Relations
  • Conduct marketing events, presentations, event planning, drafting communications, social media outreach and providing business tools support
  • Assist with customer troubleshooting, engagement and customer resolution
2020 Gridtern Departments included: Community and Customer Management, Business Services, Customer Delivery

Human Resources ▪ Labor Relations ▪ Psychology
  • Plan employee events, spearhead meetings, coordinate volunteer events and focus on strategic workforce planning
  • Collaborate with other Human Resource Gridterns to plan and facilitate National Intern Day
2020 Gridtern Departments included: Labor Relations, Employee Engagement, Human Resource Business Partnering

Finance ▪ Accounting ▪ Data Analytics ▪ Economics
  • Tasked with allocation reviews and maintaining the selection of expense charges in order to gage business efficiency
  • Review and analyze data within the business to help look for inconsistencies in allocation entries
  • Responsible for the internal and external financial reporting process for the FERC entities
2020 Gridtern Departments included: Finance Reporting, Plant Accounting, Center of Excellence, Data Analytics

Computer Science ▪ Information Technology ▪ Information Systems
  • Data analytics and dashboard design for a mobile deployment project
  • Conduct research in artificial intelligence and block chain
2020 Gridtern Departments included: Advanced Data and Energy Forecasting, Robotic Process Automation, Information Technology

Next Steps

National Grid’s Talent Acquisition Team shares qualified candidates’ applications with departments participating in the Gridtern program based on the interests you have noted in your resume and cover letter. Please note: if advanced to the next step in the selection process, you will be asked to submit your candidate profile to a specific department(s). At that time, you will receive more information on the department, role, location, and detailed responsibilities of the position(s).

Qualifications
  • Have accumulated 18 or more credits and be 18 years of age
  • Authorized to work in the United States for the entire duration of the internship
  • Registered in school as a full-time student and continuing education full-time for Fall 2021 Semester
  • Some intern positions will require a valid US Driver’s license. This qualification will be included in department specific Gridtern position(s) during the next step of the selection process

More Information

If you’re interested in working in other National Grid locations, check out our postings for internships in: New England, Downstate New York or Upstate New York. You must apply to location specific postings in order to be considered for that area. National Grid does not offer relocation, housing assistance, or public transportation reimbursement for Gridterns; however, we can provide a list of resources for hired Gridterns to utilize in making their own arrangements.

About Strava

Strava is Swedish for “strive,” which epitomizes who we are and what we do. We’re a passionate and committed team, unified by our mission to connect athletes to what motivates them and help them find their personal best. And with billions of activity uploads from all over the world, we have a humbling and audacious vision: to be the record of the world’s athletic activities and the technology that makes every effort count.

Strava builds software that makes the best part of our athletes’ days even better. And just as we’re deeply committed to unlocking their potential, we’re dedicated to providing a world-class, inclusive workplace where our employees can grow and thrive, too. We’re backed by Sequoia Capital, Madrone Partners and Jackson Square Ventures, and we’re expanding in order to exceed the needs of our growing community of global athletes. Our culture reflects our community – we are continuously striving to hire and engage diverse teammates from all backgrounds, experiences and perspectives because we know we are a stronger team together.

In light of the global pandemic, Strava is currently working in a fully remote capacity. As always, we remain committed to fully supporting our employees, especially their mental health and wellbeing, through these challenging times. Despite challenges in the world around us, we are continuing to grow camaraderie and positivity within our culture and we are unified in our commitment to becoming an antiracist company . We are differentiated by our truly people-first approach, our compassionate leadership, and our belief that we can bring joy and inspiration to athletes’ lives — now more than ever. All to say, it’s a great time to join Strava!

About The Role

We are looking for an engineering intern to build upon our Android application. The ideal candidate has a passion for cutting edge technology, a desire to learn, and a focus on building great features that the Strava community will love. You will work on impactful, real-world projects including some of our most exciting features such as: Mobile Record, Routes, Segments, Fitness, Challenges, and more.

Interns at Strava are considered full members of the engineering team and build software that gets deployed to millions of athletes. Past interns at Strava have worked on adding the ability to upload FIT files and implementing new Streaks Challenges such as the Escape Plan .

What You’ll Do
  • Build the next generations of the Strava experience alongside a passionate and talented team of engineers and designers
  • Collaborate and incorporate feedback from product management, design, marketing, and support teams
  • Innovate during Strava Jams when engineers have four uninterrupted days to hack on a project of their choosing
  • This is a 3 month Summer internship


About You
  • Pursuing BS/MS in Computer Science or related fields
  • Rising Senior (2022 grad)
  • Programming experience in Java
  • Disciplined approach to testing and quality assurance
  • Humble and empathetic with a willingness to learn

Bonus Points
  • Programming experience in Kotlin
  • Familiarity with the Android Activity/Fragment Lifecycle
  • Familiarity with git/vcs

Strava is an equal opportunity employer. In keeping with the values of Strava, we make all employment decisions including hiring, evaluation, termination, promotional and training opportunities, without regard to race, religion, color, sex, age, national origin, ancestry, sexual orientation, physical handicap, mental disability, medical condition, disability, gender or identity or expression, pregnancy or pregnancy-related condition, marital status, height and/or weight.

We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

California Consumer Protection Act Applicant Notice

Job Description

POSITION SUMMARY

Sunbird (www.sunbirddcim.com), an established leader in Data Center Infrastructure Management, is looking for a Software Test Automation Intern to join our team. Our award winning web based solutions help our customers understand and manage energy consumption, environmental conditions and assets in their facilities.

This is a paid internship based out of our Raleigh, NC or Somerset, NJ.

Day to day, we use Java 7/8, Rails 4.1, Ruby, RSpec, JavaScript, PostgreSQL, Linux and GitHub.

Duties And Responsibilities

The Software Testing Automation Intern will be primarily responsible for:

  • Creating and automating test scenarios and identifying/reporting defects
  • Will be a pivotal member of an Agile Scrum team working closely with developers to drive a successful automation strategy
  • Should be passionate about quality and test automation.
  • Develop and maintain test execution steps in an automated framework
  • Review pull requests from other engineers for correctness
  • Fix specs that are broken as a result of changes to the product GUI
  • Incorporate specs into the nightly Jenkins process

    • Required Knowledge/Skills
    • Must be enrolled in or recent graduate of a Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or Electrical Engineering program (or similar field)
    • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
    • Knowledge of software test automation
    • Experience with scripting

    Desired Knowledge/Skills

    A candidate with any of the following will be at an advantage:
    • Linux power user
    • Experience with Capybara/rspec platform or a similar framework
    • Experience with Jenkins

    Company Description

  • Company: www.sunbirddcim.com
  • About the state of DCIM industry: https://datacenterfrontier.com/gartners-hype-cycle-dcim-software/
